TAR Retriever Service. org.dcm4chex.archive.dcm.hsm.TarRetrieverService The default constructor TarRetrieverService Root directory in which retrieved tars are extracted. A relative path name is resolved relative to archive-install-directory/server/default/. Attention: For reliable function of the deletion of least recent accessed objects, a separate file system should be used for the cache. CacheRoot java.lang.String Minimum free disk space on Cache Directory. If the free available disk space on the cache directory falls below this value, least recent accessed sub-directories are deleted, BEFORE further TARs are retrieved and extracted. 1MB = 1000000 bytes, 1GB = 1000MB. MinimumFreeDiskSpace java.lang.String Preferred free disk space on Cache Directory. If the free available disk space on the cache directory falls below this value, least recent accessed sub-directories are deleted, WITHOUT blocking retrieve and extraction of further TARs. 1MB = 1000000 bytes, 1GB = 1000MB. PreferredFreeDiskSpace java.lang.String Defines if the MD5 sum of TAR file entries shall be checked against values in first entry MD5SUM file during retrieval. If the check fails, the retrieval will fail. If activated, but the first TAR entry is not the MD5SUM file, a WARN messages will be logged in server.log. CheckMD5 boolean External command to fetch tarballs from the source file system, with
%d will be replaced by the source file system name,
%f will be replaced by the path of tarball on the source file system,
%p will be replaced by the destination path.
NONE = TAR file on local accessable file system. TarFetchCommand java.lang.String Directory in which TARs shall be retrieved by external TarFetchCommand. A relative path name is resolved relative to archive-install-directory/server/default/. Not effective if TarFetchCommand=NONE TarIncomingDirectory java.lang.String Size of write byte buffer. BufferSize int Number of cached references to least recent accessed directories. LRUCacheSize int &defaultAttributes; &defaultOperations; Retrieve file from TAR specified by File System ID and File ID. retrieveFileFromTAR File System ID fsID java.lang.String File ID fileID java.lang.String java.io.File Delete oldest directories to free specified amount of disk space. free minimal amount of disk space to be released amount long long
